title.value: Adult Mental Health Service Discharge Summary

tr.td: Accident and emergency or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
NHS other Hospital Provider - Ward for general Patients or the younger physically disabled or A and E department

td.p: Jon was taken to casualty and admitted to a medical ward two weeks ago after taking a serious overdose of paracetamol and drinking half a bottle of whisky.
He was found unconscious face down among the bushes in a local park.
Jon had been depressed for some months prior to this having lost his job as a building surveyor.
He was having difficulty sleeping and often waking early, sometimes at three of four in the morning.

tr.th: Treatments and interventions and changes made to treatments

td.p: While on the ward his suicidal urges have reduced and he has been started on an atypical antidepressant to good effect.
He now regrets attempting to take his own life, is thankful for the support of his family and looks forward to commencing psychological therapies for depression (IAPT) and seeking new employment.

tr.td: Patient discharged on clinical advice or with clinical consent

Usual place of residence unless listed below, for example, a private dwelling whether owner occupied or owned by Local Authority, housing association or other landlord. This includes wardened accommodation but not residential accommodation where health care is provided. It also includes Patients with no fixed abode.
No special requirements but always wants family to be kept informed
Patient referred to local IAPT services for CBT for Depression.

tr.td: Patient stated "I do not want ECT."

Name: Eve Burrows

td.p: Address Line: Twenty One Fifty, Thorpe Park,
Routine follow up will be needed from Primary Care e.g. Well man clinic.
Person responsible: Dr Gillingham, Leeds Recovery and Support Team.
Outcome and expectations: The patient expects to benefit from attendance at the Well man clinic.

tr.th: Actions for patient or their carer
tr.td: Patient to commence psychological therapies for depression.

tr.th: Agreed with patient or legitimate patient representative
tr.td: Patient has agreed to treatment plan.
Assessment using health of the nation outcome scale
Has taken an overdose of paracetamol, but no risks to self on discharge providing patient continues his medication.
Lives with wife and two teenage daughters
Patient currently employed after having lost his job as a building surveyor.
Drank half a bottle of whisky prior to admittance to Emergency department. (Patient states he does not normally drink.)
Patient stated he "Took a few paracetamol" prior to admittance to Emergency department. No history of substance use.
